bibl.title: Archaeology of Discourse: The Scribal Tradition in the Roman Fayyum and the House of Life at Dime.
bibl.note: 1. The House of Life in Dime: Obstacles on the way to understanding an Egyptian institution. - 2. The provenance ""Dime"" as a Problem in Demotic studies. - 3. The ""Demotic documentary Dime hand"" vs. the ""Second hand of Dime"". - 4. The corpus of Egyptian non-documentary sources from Dime. - 5. The ""second hand"" of Dime - did it exist?

bibl.title: Soknopaios. The Temple and Worship. Proceedings of the First Round Table of the Centro di Studi Papirologici of Università del Salento, Lecce - October 9th 2013

bibl.seg: Martin Andreas Stadler, Archaeology of Discourse: The Scribal Tradition in the Roman Fayyum and the House of Life at Dime.

Mario Capasso & Paola Davoli (edd.), Soknopaios. The Temple and Worship. Proceedings of the First Round Table of the Centro di Studi Papirologici of Università del Salento, Lecce - October 9th 2013 = Edaphos. Colloqui del Centro di Studi Papirologici dell'Università del Salento. 1 (Lecce, 2015) pp. 187-232, 2 tabl.

1. The House of Life in Dime: Obstacles on the way to understanding an Egyptian institution. - 2. The provenance ""Dime"" as a Problem in Demotic studies. - 3. The ""Demotic documentary Dime hand"" vs. the ""Second hand of Dime"". - 4. The corpus of Egyptian non-documentary sources from Dime. - 5. The ""second hand"" of Dime - did it exist?
